posts.title: The Evolution of the Love Poem
posts.text: Discover the history of love poetry from some of history's greatest poets. From Rumi in the 13th century, to Shakespeare, to modern-day masters, find your favorites and let us know yours.

posts.title: Thrilling Dystopian Stories Similar to Bird Box
posts.text: Bird Box and other similar stories are usually labeled under the term "dystopian fiction." These types of books have always been popular, especially because they present the idea of what could be. We've compiled a list of books that provide their own view into the future of possible worlds.

posts.title: Book Review: "Black Fortunes" by Shomari Wills
posts.text: Read a preview of this book about six African Americans who defied post-slavery hatred to become millionaires.

posts.title: Harriet Tubman: Death or Liberty
posts.text: Known for her courage and determination moving people through the Underground Railroad, Harriet Tubman has a far deeper story that's usually not covered in school books. Read more about her life and influence.

posts.title: In Defense of Edith Wharton
posts.text: Wharton is best known by the adaptations of her work — and there have been many.

posts.title: So You've Taken the MTA Conductor Exam... Now What?
posts.text: A companion post for test takers of the MTA Conductor exam.

posts.title: DC Comics Animated Films
posts.text: While this is just the beginning of their live-action film plans, DC Comics has some of the most well-known superheroes and has long found success in animated features.

posts.title: Hamilton, An American Musical: A Reading and Resource List
posts.text: Why was Hamilton so important that he deserves recognition today? Find books and resources on the “10-dollar founding father without a father.”

posts.title: Men, Sex, and the Literary Novel
posts.text: The discussion of the change in how sex is presented in literary novels, particularly by male authors, has taken place several times over the last few years. This type of novel, which at one point was ubiquitous in the publishing world, has fallen out of favor.

posts.title: Batman vs Superman: Recommended Reading List
posts.text: Batman vs Superman marks the first time the two heroes have appeared in a live action film together. The story in the film does not come from any particular comic but there were some that provided inspiration, so read them and brush up on your hero knowledge!

posts.title: Preparing for the 2016 MTA Conductor Exam
posts.text: Where to find the exam prep book and the things you can learn without it—all you need is a library card.

posts.title: The Witch: A Reading and Resource List
posts.text: Already being touted as one of the best horror films of the year, The Witch is the story of a New England family that slowly begins to fall apart when they are banished from their Pilgrim community. Writer and Director Robert Eggers recently mentioned in an interview that he used the library's resources to do research for the film.

posts.title: Spotlight On: Meshell Ndegeocello
posts.text: Singer Me'shell Ndegeocello has been in the music industry for over 20 years. Come take a peek into her world and discover the artist behind the music.

posts.title: Antiheroes in Graphic Novels
posts.text: These characters often work outside of the law, and depending on the situation may be friend or foe to someone in distress. Read on for some of our favorite comic book antiheroes.

posts.title: Waiting for "Empire" Reading and Viewing List
posts.text: Fox's new television series, Empire, is a family drama set in the hip-hop world. For fans of the show left wanting more, here is a list of fiction and nonfiction titles that you might enjoy.

posts.title: Homemade Natural Beauty Products Made Easy
posts.text: The Epiphany Library is offering two workshops in April on making beauty products at home. While in the class we are specifically only making two items, lip balm and body scrub (both of which are surprisingly easy), there is also a section in which we discuss why someone would want to do this. Below is the presentation, some handy recipes and also books and websites for the budding beauty alchemist.

posts.title: Book Discussion at Epiphany, "The Wine of Solitude" by Irène Némirovsky
Book Discussion at Epiphany, "I Am Forbidden" by Anouk Markovits
Book Discussion at Epiphany: "The Dovekeepers" by Alice Hoffman
Book Discussion at Epiphany: "Caleb's Crossing" by Geraldine Brooks
Book Discussion at Epiphany: "Home" by Toni Morrison
